intendedSetting: Accountability Court / Drug Court Skills Group

dailyJournalTemplates.title: Daily Journal A: Awareness + Skills Noticing
instructions: Complete once per day. Keep entries short and factual.
If you had no major stressors, use a small everyday example.
prompts: What was my first thought? What did it push me to do?
What skill did I try (or could I have tried)?
One wise decision I made today (even if small).

dailyJournalTemplates.title: Daily Journal B: Emotion + Urge + Body
instructions: Use 0–10 ratings for emotion and urge/craving intensity.
prompts: Emotion(s) today (0–10). Where did I feel it in my body?
What vulnerability factor was present (sleep, hunger, stress, conflict, isolation)?
What did I do that reduced harm today?

dailyJournalTemplates.title: Daily Journal C: Relationships + Values + Boundaries
instructions: If you had little contact with others, focus on one interaction (staff, coworker, family, phone call, text) or a planned interaction.
prompts: What did I want/need? Did I ask?
Did I keep self-respect? Did I act on values?
One repair I made (or could make).

standardSessionFlow.review: Review last week’s practice: where skill worked, where it didn’t, what blocked it.
standardSessionFlow.teach: Teach today’s core concept in plain language with drug-court relevant examples.
standardSessionFlow.practice: Complete the in-class worksheet and discuss (pairs/small groups).
standardSessionFlow.homework: Assign homework; clarify minimum viable practice (1 use + 1 journal entry).

weeks.title: Orientation: DBT for Drug Court
weeks.sessionPurpose: Introduce DBT as a skills-based program that supports court compliance and recovery through practicing specific behaviors.
discussionPrompts: What does a life worth living mean for you in this program right now?
What keeps people stuck in the same cycle even when they want change?
What is one thing you want to do differently this time?

inClassWorksheet.title: My Program Target Map
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Identify top risk areas and one skills goal for the week.

fields.label: One skill goal for the next 7 days

homeworkSheet.title: Skills Commitment Contract
homeworkSheet.purpose: Commit to minimum skills practice with a barrier plan.

fields.label: If I miss a skill, I will restart within (hours)
Three support contacts or support options
One barrier I expect this week + my workaround

weeks.title: Dialectics: Two Things Can Be True
weeks.sessionPurpose: Teach acceptance + change as a both/and approach to reduce all-or-nothing thinking and increase effectiveness.
discussionPrompts: How can you accept reality and still work to change it?
Where do you get stuck in extreme (all-or-nothing) thinking?
What is the cost of insisting on being right during conflict?

inClassWorksheet.title: Dialectical Reframe Practice
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Practice translating extreme thinking into a balanced acceptance + change plan.

fields.label: Middle path behavior (what I will do next time)

homeworkSheet.title: Dialectics Log (3 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Track situations where you practiced the middle path.

weeks.title: States of Mind: Emotion Mind, Reasonable Mind, Wise Mind
weeks.sessionPurpose: Teach three mind states and practice generating wise-mind responses to stress.
discussionPrompts: What does Emotion Mind look like for you during cravings or conflict?
What does Reasonable Mind miss about recovery?
How do you recognize Wise Mind?

inClassWorksheet.title: Wise Mind Snapshot
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Practice identifying emotion mind and reasonable mind, then choosing a wise-mind response.

homeworkSheet.title: Wise Mind Practice x4
homeworkSheet.purpose: Complete four Wise Mind Snapshots during the week.

weeks.title: Mindfulness What Skill: Observe
weeks.sessionPurpose: Build the ability to notice urges and emotions without immediately acting.
discussionPrompts: What happens when you notice an urge without reacting?
What do you usually do to avoid noticing feelings?
How does observing help with court choices?

inClassWorksheet.title: Urge Observation Ladder
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Practice observing a trigger/urge as body sensations, thoughts, and action urges.

homeworkSheet.title: Observe Challenge (7 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Observe one urge or emotion daily and record three facts.

weeks.title: Mindfulness What Skill: Describe
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice labeling experiences clearly (facts, feelings, urges) to reduce escalation and confusion.
discussionPrompts: Why do labels reduce chaos?
What labels help you stay out of court trouble?
What is the difference between facts and stories?

inClassWorksheet.title: Facts vs. Story
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Separate observable facts from interpretations and choose an effective next step.

homeworkSheet.title: Describe It Clean (5 entries)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Write five situations with facts + feeling + urge.

weeks.title: Mindfulness What Skill: Participate
weeks.sessionPurpose: Increase engagement in life and recovery by practicing participation rather than avoidance.
discussionPrompts: What is participating when you do not feel like it?
Where do you check out and what does it cost you?
What does participation look like in court, work, or treatment?

inClassWorksheet.title: Participation Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Choose one area of avoidance and plan a small participation step.

homeworkSheet.title: Participation Streak (7 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Complete one small participation step daily and record outcomes.

weeks.title: Mindfulness How Skill: Nonjudgmental Stance
weeks.sessionPurpose: Reduce shame and escalation by translating judgments into neutral descriptions and effective actions.
discussionPrompts: How do judgments increase relapse risk?
Difference between 'I messed up' and 'I am a mess'?
How does shame affect honesty with staff?

inClassWorksheet.title: Judgment Translation
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Translate a judgment into a neutral description and an effective action.

homeworkSheet.title: Nonjudgmental Rewrites (10)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Rewrite ten judgment statements into neutral descriptions.

weeks.title: Mindfulness How Skill: One-Mindful
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice focusing on one task at a time to reduce impulsivity and improve follow-through.
discussionPrompts: Multitasking vs. one-mindful: which helps recovery?
What happens when you are half-in/half-out of treatment?
How does one-mindful reduce impulsivity?

inClassWorksheet.title: One-Mindful Routine
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Plan one daily activity to do one-mindfully and define a return cue.

fields.label: How I will know it worked

homeworkSheet.title: One-Mindful Daily (7 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Practice one-mindful activity daily and track distractions and returns.

weeks.title: Mindfulness How Skill: Effectiveness
weeks.sessionPurpose: Teach choosing what works (effective behavior) over being right, fair, or in control.
discussionPrompts: Effective vs fair vs right: which keeps you free?
What is one fight you keep losing because you want to be right?
How does effectiveness support compliance without losing self-respect?

inClassWorksheet.title: Effectiveness Decision Tool
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Identify goals and choose an effective alternative action.

homeworkSheet.title: Effectiveness Swap (3 situations)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Identify three times you chose 'right' over 'effective' and rewrite.

weeks.title: Behavior Change Basics: Mini Chain Analysis
weeks.sessionPurpose: Introduce behavior chains and identify one link where a different skillful choice is possible.
discussionPrompts: What is the difference between a slip and a chain?
Where do your chains start (sleep, people, pride, money)?
What is one link you can change this week?

inClassWorksheet.title: Mini Chain Analysis
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Break down a problem behavior into trigger, vulnerabilities, thoughts/feelings, urges, and alternatives.

homeworkSheet.title: Mini Chain x2
homeworkSheet.purpose: Complete two mini chain analyses during the week.

fields.label: One link I changed or could change

weeks.title: Problem-Solving Steps
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice small-step problem-solving that fits limited time and resources.
discussionPrompts: When does problem-solving help and when does it become avoidance?
What problems keep bringing you back to the same outcomes?
How can you plan when money and time are limited?

inClassWorksheet.title: Small-Step Problem Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Turn one problem into a 24-hour next step.

homeworkSheet.title: 2 Plans + 2 Follow-ups
homeworkSheet.purpose: Create two plans and report what you did.

weeks.title: Validation Basics (Self + Others)
weeks.sessionPurpose: Teach validation as a tool for reducing escalation and improving cooperation without excusing behavior.
discussionPrompts: Why do people relapse when they feel invalidated?
What does self-validation look like without excusing behavior?
How do you validate without agreeing?

inClassWorksheet.title: Validation Scripts
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Write self-validation and other-validation statements for real situations.

fields.label: Situation where I will try validation

homeworkSheet.title: Validation Practice Log (7 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Practice one self-validation and one other-validation daily.

weeks.title: Skills Breakdown Point: Early Warning Signs
weeks.sessionPurpose: Identify early, mid, and late signs of dysregulation and pick one usable skill per stage.
discussionPrompts: What does skills breakdown feel like in your body?
What do you do when you are past your thinking brain?
What is your early warning signal?

inClassWorksheet.title: My Breakdown Signs
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Map early/mid/late signs and one skill that still works late.

fields.label: Skill I can still do when late

homeworkSheet.title: Crisis Plan Draft
homeworkSheet.purpose: Draft warning signs + three crisis actions + three safe contacts/places.

weeks.title: Values + Life Worth Living (Drug Court Aligned)
weeks.sessionPurpose: Connect values to specific court-safe behaviors and weekly action steps.
discussionPrompts: What do you want your life to look like after court?
Which choices move you toward that life?
What value do you want to practice this week?

inClassWorksheet.title: Values-to-Behavior Bridge
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Translate one value into concrete recovery, relationship, and court behaviors.

fields.label: One court-safe behavior that shows it

homeworkSheet.title: Values Practice x7
homeworkSheet.purpose: Daily value + one action.

weeks.title: Mindfulness Review + Skill Integration
weeks.sessionPurpose: Select top skills and identify common blocks to using them under stress.
discussionPrompts: Which mindfulness skill changed your week most?
Where did you resist skills and why?
What is your go-to skill under stress?

inClassWorksheet.title: My Top 3 Skills Card
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a personal quick-reference card for top skills and barriers.

fields.label: What I will do when blocked

homeworkSheet.title: Skill Reps (7 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Use one skill daily and record situation and effect.

weeks.title: Section 1 Checkpoint + Readiness Bridge
weeks.sessionPurpose: Review gains and set two goals for the next section: one emotion goal and one crisis goal.
discussionPrompts: What do you understand about your patterns now?
What skill do you still avoid?
What would make the next section successful?

inClassWorksheet.title: Section 1 Progress Snapshot
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Summarize biggest change, biggest struggle, and support needs.

fields.label: Skill I am committing to keep

homeworkSheet.title: Section 2 Prep Goals
homeworkSheet.purpose: Pick an emotion goal and a crisis goal for the next 30 days.

weeks.title: Understanding Emotions: What Emotions Do
weeks.sessionPurpose: Teach the functions of emotions and identify emotions that commonly precede relapse or violations.
discussionPrompts: What is the job of anger? fear? shame?
What emotions show up before you use?
What emotions show up before you violate conditions?

inClassWorksheet.title: Emotion Job Chart
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Identify emotion functions and skillful responses.

fields.label: What it pushes me to do

homeworkSheet.title: Emotion Tracking (7 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Track one emotion per day with intensity, trigger, and action urge.

weeks.title: Naming Emotions + Body Signals
weeks.sessionPurpose: Increase emotional literacy by linking body cues to emotion labels and early interventions.
discussionPrompts: How does your body warn you before your behavior changes?
What happens when you mislabel emotions?
How does labeling reduce impulsivity?

inClassWorksheet.title: Body Signals Map
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Identify where stress/anger/craving show up and what to do early.

homeworkSheet.title: Body Signal Log (5 entries)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Log body signals, label the emotion, and choose a skill.

weeks.title: Check the Facts
weeks.sessionPurpose: Reduce emotion-driven assumptions by checking facts and generating alternative interpretations.
discussionPrompts: When did your feelings not match the facts?
How do assumptions escalate conflict with staff/family?
What are your most common court-thinking errors?

inClassWorksheet.title: Facts Check
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Practice separating interpretations from facts and choosing an effective next step.

homeworkSheet.title: Check the Facts x3
homeworkSheet.purpose: Use the facts check three times and record what changed.

weeks.title: Opposite Action
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice acting opposite to unhelpful urges when emotions are not justified or not effective.
discussionPrompts: When does acting how you feel keep you trapped?
What is opposite action for shame? anger? fear?
Where can you practice safely?

inClassWorksheet.title: Opposite Action Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Plan an opposite-action behavior and how to measure success.

homeworkSheet.title: Opposite Action x4
homeworkSheet.purpose: Try opposite action four times and rate intensity change.

weeks.title: Solve the Problem vs Change the Emotion vs Tolerate
weeks.sessionPurpose: Choose the right skills pathway depending on what is changeable and what is not.
discussionPrompts: When do you solve the problem versus change the emotion?
What repeat problem needs solving?
Where does avoidance show up?

inClassWorksheet.title: Choose the Path
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Decide whether to solve, change emotion, or tolerate; select a first step.

homeworkSheet.title: Two Paths Practice
homeworkSheet.purpose: Do one problem-solving plan and one emotion-change attempt.

weeks.title: Build Positive Experiences (Short-Term)
weeks.sessionPurpose: Increase healthy reinforcement by building a low-cost menu of positive activities.
discussionPrompts: Why does recovery collapse when life is only 'don’t use'?
What low-cost positives work in your real life?
What positives reduce cravings?

inClassWorksheet.title: Low-Cost Positive Menu
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a menu and select three activities for this week.

homeworkSheet.title: Positive Activity Log (3)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Plan and do three activities; rate effect.

weeks.title: Build Positive Experiences (Long-Term) + Goals
weeks.sessionPurpose: Connect long-term goals to small steps that build a stable recovery lifestyle.
discussionPrompts: What long-term goal makes court worth it?
How do goals protect you from relapse?
What is one next-right-step goal?

inClassWorksheet.title: Goal Ladder
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create 6-month, 3-month, 1-week, and 24-hour steps.

homeworkSheet.title: Goal Step Execution
homeworkSheet.purpose: Complete the 24-hour step and reflect.

weeks.title: PLEASE: Vulnerability Reduction Basics
weeks.sessionPurpose: Reduce emotional vulnerability through realistic sleep, nutrition, and health behavior planning.
discussionPrompts: How do sleep and hunger show up in your attitude?
How does illness or stress increase relapse risk?
What is one small health habit you can actually do?

inClassWorksheet.title: PLEASE Micro Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a realistic plan for sleep, eating, and one health action.

homeworkSheet.title: PLEASE Tracker (7 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Track sleep, meals, activity minutes, and health actions.

weeks.title: Build Mastery + Cope Ahead
weeks.sessionPurpose: Increase mastery experiences and prepare for predictable high-risk events using cope-ahead planning.
discussionPrompts: Why does mastery reduce shame?
What mastery task can you do despite low resources?
What is one high-risk event you can cope-ahead for?

inClassWorksheet.title: Cope Ahead Script
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Write a cope-ahead rehearsal including skills, obstacles, and backup plan.

homeworkSheet.title: Cope Ahead x2
homeworkSheet.purpose: Complete two cope-ahead plans; reflect after each event.

weeks.title: Distress Tolerance: Crisis vs. Problem
weeks.sessionPurpose: Differentiate crises from solvable problems and apply the right strategy.
discussionPrompts: What makes something a crisis in your body/brain?
What do you do that makes it worse?
What does 'survive without making it worse' mean?

inClassWorksheet.title: Crisis Decision Tree
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Decide whether to problem-solve or use crisis survival skills.

fields.label: If no: crisis survival skills list

homeworkSheet.title: Crisis Tree Use x2
homeworkSheet.purpose: Use the crisis decision tree twice and record outcomes.

weeks.title: STOP + Pause Skills
weeks.sessionPurpose: Build a pause between trigger and action using a simple STOP-based plan.
discussionPrompts: Where do you speed up and lose control?
What does your pause look like?
Who can you contact before this becomes a violation?

inClassWorksheet.title: Pause Plan Card
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a personal STOP cue, grounding step, and contact plan.

homeworkSheet.title: Pause Practice (daily)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Practice pause once daily (even when calm) and record.

weeks.title: TIP Skills: Fast Body Regulation
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice body-based regulation strategies for rapid reduction of emotional arousal.
discussionPrompts: Why do body skills work faster than thinking skills?
When do you need fast skills vs slow skills?
What is safe and appropriate in your setting?

inClassWorksheet.title: Fast Regulation Menu
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Identify three body-based skills you can safely use and when.

fields.label: Three body-based skills I can do safely

homeworkSheet.title: TIP Reps x5
homeworkSheet.purpose: Try fast regulation five times; rate intensity before/after.

weeks.title: Self-Soothing + Grounding (5 senses)
weeks.sessionPurpose: Build low-cost soothing and grounding strategies to tolerate distress without impulsive action.
discussionPrompts: What is soothing versus avoidance?
What can you do with low money?
What helps you tolerate shame without using?

inClassWorksheet.title: 5-Senses Soothing Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a plan with one soothing option per sense.

homeworkSheet.title: Soothing Practice x7
homeworkSheet.purpose: Practice one sense-based soothing strategy daily.

weeks.title: Reality Acceptance: Radical Acceptance + Willingness
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice accepting what cannot be changed today and choosing willing actions aligned with recovery.
discussionPrompts: What reality are you still fighting?
How does fighting reality increase suffering and relapse risk?
What does willingness look like in drug court?

inClassWorksheet.title: Acceptance Statement Builder
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Write acceptance and change statements plus a willing action.

homeworkSheet.title: Radical Acceptance x3
homeworkSheet.purpose: Complete three acceptance entries during the week.

weeks.title: Addiction-Focused Crisis Skills: Slip Response Plan
weeks.sessionPurpose: Reduce lapse-to-relapse risk by planning immediate actions after a slip or near-slip.
discussionPrompts: What does abstinence mean in behavior, not just words?
What happens after a slip if shame drives the next choice?
How do you return to recovery fast?

inClassWorksheet.title: Slip Response Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a personal 24-hour plan after a slip or near-slip.

fields.label: My three early actions after a slip

homeworkSheet.title: Bridge Back Plan
homeworkSheet.purpose: Write a 24-hour return plan and rehearse once.

weeks.title: Section 2 Checkpoint: Emotion Plan + Crisis Plan
weeks.sessionPurpose: Consolidate learning into two usable plans: emotion regulation plan and crisis plan.
discussionPrompts: What skill reduced intensity the fastest?
What vulnerability factor hits you hardest?
What plan do you trust enough to use?

inClassWorksheet.title: My Two Plans
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Finalize an emotion plan and crisis plan using your most effective skills.

fields.label: Emotion plan: top triggers + top skills
Crisis plan: warning signs + steps + contacts

homeworkSheet.title: Plan Test Week
homeworkSheet.purpose: Use emotion plan twice and crisis plan once; record what worked.

weeks.title: Interpersonal Goals: Objective, Relationship, Self-Respect
weeks.sessionPurpose: Clarify interpersonal priorities and choose balanced actions aligned with goals.
discussionPrompts: Which goal do you sacrifice first under stress?
How does pride show up as self-respect versus ego?
What goals matter most with probation or case managers?

inClassWorksheet.title: Goal Picker
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Clarify objective, relationship, and self-respect goals in a real situation.

homeworkSheet.title: Goal Picker x3
homeworkSheet.purpose: Complete three goal pickers for real situations.

weeks.title: Asking for What You Need: Clear Ask Builder
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice making clear, respectful requests without aggression or passive hints.
discussionPrompts: Why do people hint instead of ask?
What happens when you ask aggressively or passively?
What is a respectful ask in drug court context?

inClassWorksheet.title: Clear Ask Builder
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Build a structured request script and a negotiation option.

homeworkSheet.title: One Ask
homeworkSheet.purpose: Use the script once (or role-play) and record results.

weeks.title: Saying No / Setting Limits: Boundary Script
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice saying no and setting limits without escalation or guilt-driven overexplaining.
discussionPrompts: What is the difference between boundaries and control?
What do you say yes to that wrecks your progress?
How do you say no without escalating?

inClassWorksheet.title: Boundary Script
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Write a one-sentence no plus a broken-record line.

homeworkSheet.title: Boundary Rep x2
homeworkSheet.purpose: Use boundary script twice or role-play twice.

weeks.title: Conflict De-escalation + Repair
weeks.sessionPurpose: Reduce conflict escalation and increase repair behaviors that protect recovery and compliance.
discussionPrompts: What is your conflict pattern: fight, flee, freeze, appease?
How does conflict connect to relapse?
What does a repair sound like?

inClassWorksheet.title: Repair Map
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a repair statement and action repair for a recent conflict.

homeworkSheet.title: One Repair Attempt
homeworkSheet.purpose: Make one repair attempt or prepare a safe repair message.

weeks.title: Validation in Conflict: Validation Ladder
weeks.sessionPurpose: Use validation to reduce defensiveness and improve cooperation while maintaining boundaries.
discussionPrompts: How can you validate without agreeing?
What happens when people feel heard?
How does validation help with authority figures?

inClassWorksheet.title: Validation Ladder
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Practice three levels of validation and write example lines.

fields.label: Where I will use it this week

homeworkSheet.title: Validate 7 Days
homeworkSheet.purpose: Validate one person daily and record effects.

weeks.title: Building Relationships: Support Inventory
weeks.sessionPurpose: Identify safe supports and create one action step to reduce isolation.
discussionPrompts: What makes a safe person versus a fun person?
Why does isolation raise relapse risk?
Where can you build healthy supports in your community?

inClassWorksheet.title: Support Inventory
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Sort supports into protective vs risky and choose a new environment.

homeworkSheet.title: Support Action
homeworkSheet.purpose: Attend one prosocial activity/meeting and reflect.

weeks.title: Maintaining Relationships: Trust Behaviors Plan
weeks.sessionPurpose: Strengthen relationships through consistent trust-building behaviors and repair planning.
discussionPrompts: What behaviors build trust?
What behaviors break trust fast?
What does consistency look like when stressed?

inClassWorksheet.title: Trust Behaviors Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Choose trust-building actions and identify trust-breaking behaviors to avoid.

homeworkSheet.title: Trust Behaviors Log (7 days)
homeworkSheet.purpose: Track daily trust behaviors and repair attempts.

weeks.title: Ending Destructive Relationships / High-Risk People: Exit Plan
weeks.sessionPurpose: Plan boundaries or exits from high-risk relationships and build replacement supports.
discussionPrompts: How do you know a relationship is destructive?
What keeps people attached to high-risk connections?
What is a safe exit plan?

inClassWorksheet.title: Exit Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create boundary/exit steps and safety considerations.

homeworkSheet.title: One Exit Step
homeworkSheet.purpose: Take one safe step toward distancing or boundary-setting.

weeks.title: Middle Path: Balancing Acceptance and Change in Relationships
weeks.sessionPurpose: Reduce interpersonal extremes by choosing middle-path behaviors and compromises.
discussionPrompts: Where do you swing extreme (all-in/all-out)?
What does compromise look like without losing yourself?
How does middle path reduce chaos?

inClassWorksheet.title: Middle Path Map
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Map two extremes and plan a middle-path response.

homeworkSheet.title: Middle Path x3
homeworkSheet.purpose: Practice middle path in three situations.

weeks.title: Communication Under Stress: Pause-Then-Speak Plan
weeks.sessionPurpose: Identify flooding cues and use pause strategies to communicate clearly.
discussionPrompts: What happens when you talk while flooded?
What timing makes conflict worse?
What is one communication habit you want to change?

inClassWorksheet.title: Pause-Then-Speak Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Build a communication plan that starts with pausing when flooded.

homeworkSheet.title: Message Practice x2
homeworkSheet.purpose: Practice two messages (real or role-play) and reflect.

weeks.title: Accountability + Honesty (Drug Court Specific)
weeks.sessionPurpose: Practice honest disclosure scripts that reduce shame-driven avoidance and improve compliance.
discussionPrompts: Why is honesty hard when shame is high?
What is the cost of managing impressions?
How can you be honest and still respectful?

inClassWorksheet.title: Honesty Script
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a factual disclosure statement plus a respectful request for support.

homeworkSheet.title: One Honest Conversation
homeworkSheet.purpose: Complete or prepare an honest conversation; role-play if needed.

weeks.title: Managing Shame + Self-Respect After Mistakes
weeks.sessionPurpose: Reduce shame spirals by using responsibility statements and repair actions after setbacks.
discussionPrompts: How does shame trigger using or aggression?
What is self-respect behavior when you mess up?
What does repair look like after setbacks?

inClassWorksheet.title: Self-Respect After Mistakes
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Write responsibility and repair steps for a mistake.

homeworkSheet.title: Repair + Skill Use
homeworkSheet.purpose: Do one repair plus one skill attempt; record the outcome.

weeks.title: Integrated Prevention Map (CAT/RP/DBT Integration)
weeks.sessionPurpose: Integrate triggers, warning signs, skills, and supports into one usable prevention map.
discussionPrompts: What is your most predictable relapse chain?
What is your first domino?
What support must be in place?

inClassWorksheet.title: Integrated Prevention Map
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Build a consolidated map that links triggers to skills and supports.

homeworkSheet.title: Plan Walkthrough
homeworkSheet.purpose: Rehearse the plan once and note changes.

weeks.title: Lifestyle Structure: Routines + Compliance
weeks.sessionPurpose: Use routines and structure to reduce chaos, financial stress reactivity, and compliance failures.
discussionPrompts: Which routine protects your recovery most?
What tiny structure creates big stability?
How do you plan for low money weeks?

inClassWorksheet.title: Weekly Structure Grid
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Create a simple weekly structure plan aligned with appointments and recovery supports.

homeworkSheet.title: Structure Trial Week
homeworkSheet.purpose: Follow the grid 5/7 days and record obstacles.

weeks.title: Graduation Planning: Skills Generalization Plan
weeks.sessionPurpose: Plan how skills will continue after court structure decreases; define supports and warning signs.
discussionPrompts: What skills keep you well?
What barriers show up when you are stressed?
What support will replace the structure of court?

inClassWorksheet.title: Skills Generalization Plan
inClassWorksheet.purpose: List top skills by category, warning signs, supports, and next level of care.

homeworkSheet.title: Aftercare Commitments
homeworkSheet.purpose: Write three commitments for the next 90 days.

weeks.title: Integration + Future-Self Letter + Closeout
weeks.sessionPurpose: Consolidate learning into a future-self message and a 30-day maintenance plan.
discussionPrompts: What is different about you now?
What skills changed your outcomes?
What do you want to remember when you are tempted?

inClassWorksheet.title: Letter to Future Me
inClassWorksheet.purpose: Write a short letter describing skills and supports to use during future high-risk moments.

fields.label: What I must do when urges hit

homeworkSheet.title: 30-Day Maintenance Challenge
homeworkSheet.purpose: Commit to 30 days of one skill + one journal entry.

fields.label: My plan for 30 daily journal entries
My backup plan if I miss a day
